title: Noah's Obedience
description: Questions about faith and obedience for youth

questions.text: Why was Noah chosen by God to build the ark?

options.text: He found grace in God's eyes and was righteous
options.explanation: Genesis 6:8-9 says 'But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD... Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.'

options.text: He was the strongest man alive
options.explanation: God didn't choose Noah for his physical strength, but for his righteousness.
God specifically chose Noah, Noah didn't volunteer.

questions.text: What does it mean that Noah 'walked with God'?

options.text: He lived in close fellowship and obedience to God
options.explanation: Walking with God means having a close relationship with Him and following His ways faithfully.
This is a spiritual description of Noah's relationship with God, not a physical one.
While Noah was obedient to God, 'walking with God' describes his personal relationship with God.
